page.title: 11Churches
page.content: The church of St. Mary the Virgin, Studham, dedicated 1220,is an amalgam of Early English, Decorated and Perpendicular styles of Gothic architecture.Built of"Totternhoe Clunch" which crumbled in damp and frost its exterior has been cement rendered.Its bells are dated 1599, 1627,1666.The floor around the stone font is covered with medieval tiles. Upkeep is funded by Dept. of Environment and events organised by Friends of Studham Church. The main event is the May Fair held annually. The congregation at present small is led by the Rev. J Shepherd. The present Methodist Chapel was built in 1965/6 on land donated in 1840 by G.Barnard for the original building.A grant was received from Joseph Rank Benevolent Trust. Members contributed to the building effort. Mr Bliss
